Committee: Veterans, Homeland Security And Military Affairs

Milestones.Committee: Veterans, Homeland Security And Military Affairs

Actions.Text: REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

Title: Relates to military enhanced recognition, incentive and tribute scholarships
Summary: Relates to military enhanced recognition, incentive and tribute scholarships; removes the date requirement of on and after August 2, 1990 for a member of the armed forces of the United States or state organized militia to be a member and for children, spouses and financial dependents of such member to receive such scholarships; authorizes a member of the armed forces of the United States military who: received a service-connected disability rating from the department of veterans affairs consisting of a minimum of zero percent and a maximum of one hundred percent; and was a legal resident of New York state at the time of military service to receive the MERIT scholarship; provides for eligible persons, the amount; requirements; and residency for such scholarship.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to military enhanced recognition, incentive and tribute ("MERIT") scholarships
